snippet: Mrs. Clinton reported raising more than $28 million in the last three months, only about $2 million more than Mr. Sanders, reflecting a shift in momentum.
abstract: Fund-raising figures released by presidential campaigns of Hillary Rodham Clinton and Sen Bernie Sanders show Clinton has smaller cash advantage over Sanders than she had previously; Clinton brought in over $28 million since beginning of July, while Sanders brought in over $26 million in same period, largely from small donors.

byline.contributor: Patrick Healy and Amy Chozick contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton reported raising more than $28 million in the last three months, only about $2 million more than Mr. Sanders, reflecting a shift in momentum.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Narrows Fund-Raising Gap With Hillary Clinton
headline.print_headline: Sanders Shrinks Gap With Clinton in Fund-Raising
